Experience from the United States and UK have suggested that race/ethnicity may play a role in the severity of COVID‐19 infection. Data from the CDC found that in patients hospitalized for COVID‐19 disease, black patients represented 33% of the COVID‐19 inpatient population while representing only 18% of the community in general, respectively.
11 This suggests a disproportionate impact on the African American population. Indigenous Peoples have also been noted to be at increased risk from COVID‐19 Disease. In the United States, the rates of COVID‐19 cases have been documented to be four times as high on reservations when compared to the country as a whole.
